trans-unit.source: Provides a page adapter for the cHTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ChtmlPageAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.
Creates and returns a text writer suitable for the given adapters.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer.
A text writer suitable for the given adapters.
Called to determine the postback data collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> object that contains request information, such as HTTP headers.
Source identifier for the event.
Argument identifier for the event.
Collection of postback data from the request object.
A modified version of the baseCollection parameter.
Evaluates whether the device adapter set applies to the specified request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Class
Returns
Preferred rendering type
Check value of JavaScript property

Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeHtml32> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeChtml10>.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.JavaScript%2A> returns `true`.

Checks whether the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeHtml32> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeChtml10>.
The device capability of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.JavaScript%2A> returns `false`.

Checks whether the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeWml11> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeWml12>.
N/A
The current request context.
`true` if the device adapter set applies to the specified request; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the key to use to submit the event argument.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The key to use to submit the event argument.
Returns the key to use to submit the event source.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The key to use to submit the event source.
Renders a reference to a postback event appropriately for the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified text writer.
The target device.
Optional event argument to pass.
Renders the header associated with postbacks.
For browsers that support script, this includes a script block to perform postback.
This API is obsolete.

The text writer.
The unique identifier for the form.
